experiments.answer: Rotating or moving component of a magnetic circuit
Width of the band of frequencies between the half power points
Device to transform mechanical energy into AC electrical power
A device that converts a radiated electromagnetic wave into an electrical wave.
The natural difference of potential that exists across a forward biased pn junction.
They are equipment that will operate on either an AC or DC power source.

The combination of reactive power and true power is called apparent power, and it is the product of a circuit's voltage and current, without reference to phase angle. Apparent power is measured in the unit of Volt-Amps (VA) and is symbolized by the capital letter S.

It is an active semiconductor device formed by two P-N junctions whose function is amplification of an electric current. Bipolar transistors are made from 3 sections of semiconductor material (alternating P-type and N-type), with 2 resulting P-N junctions.
The ac load line is a graph that represents all possible combinations of and for a given amplifier. Under normal circumstances, the ac and dc load lines for a given amplifier are not identical.
Number of positive charges

experiments.answer: considered a zero article
Name for an AC generator
A single winding transformer where the output is taken from taps on the winding.

experiments.stimuli: What is the third sentence of the second paragraph of Article 6?
experiments.answer: This is in contrast to other adjectives and determiners, which are typically optional.
It is a spring clip on the end of a test lead used to make a temporary connection.
To reduce the amplitude of an action or signal. The opposite of amplification.

experiments.stimuli: What is the first paragraph of Article 6, excluding the first sentence?
experiments.answer: In some languages, articles are a special part of speech, which cannot easily be combined with other parts of speech. It is also possible for articles to be part of another part of speech category such as a determiner, an English part of speech category that combines articles and demonstratives (such as 'this' and 'that').
A primary cell that delivers more current than a carbon-zinc cell. Also known as an 'alkaline manganese cell'.
Unit of electrical current
A base 2 number system
Power supply that delivers an AC voltage
A circuit that increases the voltage, current, or power of a signal.
A method of biasing a BJT in which the bias voltage is supplied to the base by means of a resistor.
A component that changes the amplitude of a signal between input and output.
The positive electrode or terminal of a device. The 'P' material of a diode.
A multi vibrator with two stable states. An external signal is required to change the output from one state to the other. Also called a latch.
Loss or dissipation of energy as it travels through a medium. Example: radio waves lose some of their energy as they travel through that atmosphere.
Aviation electronics

experiments.answer: such as 'this' and 'that'

A condition that occurs when a bridge circuit is adjusted to produce a zero output.

experiments.stimuli: What is the second sentence of the first paragraph of Article 6?
experiments.answer: In some languages, articles are a special part of speech, which cannot easily be combined with other parts of speech.
A voltage in which the polarity alternates.
Relating to frequencies that can be heard by the human ear. Approximately 20 Hz to 20 kHz.

experiments.stimuli: What is the second paragragh of Article 6, excluding the last 2 sentences?
experiments.answer: In languages that employ articles, every common noun, with some exceptions, is expressed with a certain definiteness, just as many languages express every noun with a certain grammatical number. Every noun must be accompanied by the article, if any, corresponding to its definiteness, and the lack of an article (considered a zero article) itself specifies a certain definiteness.
Measure of how easily AC will flow through a circuit. Admittance is the reciprocal of impedance and is measured in siemens.
